intro: Chirita mollis, commonly known as the velvetleaf or velvetleaf chireta, is a species of flowering plant in the family Gesneriaceae. It is native to tropical regions of Central and South America, where it thrives in humid, shaded environments. The plant is characterized by its heart-shaped, velvety leaves that give it its common name. Its flowers are typically small, tubular, and come in shades of yellow or orange, often with contrasting purple markings. Chirita mollis is often cultivated as a decorative plant due to its attractive foliage and unique floral display.
